sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's Monday, the 18th of July. Good morning, Europe. A very warm welcome to the program. Let's look at our top stories.

sentences.sentence: Countries across Europe issue heat weather warnings with temperatures set to soar.

sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy fires his top spy chief and prosecutor general under accusations of treason. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen travels to Azerbaijan and is expected to close a deal with Baku to increase gas imports into the EU.

sentences.sentence: Britain's flock to Brighton Beach at the weekend amid warnings that unusually high temperatures are forecast for the beginning of the week. The Met Office has issued a first ever red warning for extreme heat, cautioning there was a risk to life. Temperatures in southern England could exceed 40 degrees Celsius on Monday or Tuesday for the first time. Scientists are blaming climate change. I used to be one of those people that I think all this politics and all that, but now I think it's serious and yes we definitely need to do something about it to save our planet and save generations to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The heatwave is sweeping across Europe and has already claimed lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Spain, there have been 360 deaths from the heat, and in Portugal, as many as 659 have died over the past week. Temperatures in some cities, including Madrid, have reached 46 degrees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meteor France has now extended its orange heatwave warning to 16 departments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The extreme heat is accompanied by a wildfire crisis that has prompted thousands to evacuate parts of France, Spain and Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: to evacuate parts of France, Spain and Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In southwest France, two huge out-of-control fires have been consuming pine forests for six days in the Gironde.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: By Sunday, they'd burnt down 10,700 hectares in Test-de-Bouc and Landira.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No one's been reported hurt, but more than 14,000 people have had to be evacuated. France, like much of Europe, has been enduring an unusually extreme heatwave. This summer there have been more fires in the EU than ever before. In Spain, an out-of-control forest fire near Milla in Malaga province has burned about 2,000 hectares so far. Local media reports say people from around 650 homes have had to be evacuated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over 18 aircraft are helping drop water onto the flames, but the smoke has reduced visibility, making it even more dangerous for fire crews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Portugal, the government lowered the country's alert level on Sunday as weather conditions have been improving there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the firefighting continues, including here in the village of Mafamedes, outside the city of Porto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, the northern town of Pinau reached 47 degrees Celsius, the highest ever temperature recorded in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A Russian attack on the Bakhmut district in the Donetsk region has injured six people, including three children, according to Kyiv military reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the nearby city of Turetsk, residents told of explosions and a storm of black smoke and red fire as Russia continues its assault in the country. Kyiv has accused Moscow of launching fresh strikes on multiple residential areas in eastern and southern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in a surprise move, Ukraine's president has fired his top spy, Security Service Chief Ivan Bakunov and the country's prosecutor general, citing hundreds of criminal investigations into treason.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 60 employees of the prosecutor's office and the SBU have remained in the occupied territory working against our state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Such an array of crimes against our national security and the links recorded between Ukrainian security forces and Russian special services raise very serious questions about their respective leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even if fighting stops where they are now and the front line doesn't move, it will be very hard to survive here in winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some of their number have already paid the ultimate price. A 40-year-old local died in recent fighting in Marinka, a town near Donetsk city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is meeting Azerbaijan officials in Baku on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And she is expected to close a deal with Azerbaijan to increase imports of natural gas to the EU as the bloc tries to step back from its reliance on Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Southern Gas Corridor pipeline travels through Azerbaijan, into Georgia and Turkey, and then enters the EU through Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
